Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black with traces of two bands in added white; exterior: painted decoration consisting of sphinx (forelegs with blobs in added red and trace of underbelly and wing remaining) to left; below, two narrow bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding the standing sphinx, see Lemos no. 924 from Tocra.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 292, no. 908, pl. 121)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1207) (phase 2)
